content: crochet doll cradle/purse by pj allen pkjewelry on ravelry when i was a little girl my grandmother gave me a little cradle purse complete with a doll mattress pillow and blanket i don t know if she made the purse or bought it but i remember that it had a plastic bottom cut from an oblong shaped bottle of bleach there were holes punched at the edges of where the bottle had been cut and crochet stitches were worked through the holes to cover the cut edge of plastic before the skirt hood and drawstrings were worked i loved this little cradle purse and i carried treasures in it well into my teens although i did sometimes hide it from my friends by stashing it in a larger bag long after i had lost the doll i used the purse to care for my 10th grade family living class baby egg bring the egg everywhere for two weeks to learn what having a baby is like…realistic no but not a bad lesson just dated long story short the egg and i survived…fond memories fast forward to my 40-something years and i found a pattern i made three cradle purses using a pattern i found online that did not use a plastic jug or butter tub they were ok but i wanted a flatter base now that i am 55 why not revisit this bit of nostalgia so i looked at what was out there and i really didn t like the patterns i found why not re- work this as my own aaaaand here we are you and i materials worsted weight yarn in two colors mc ~45g cc ~25g crochet hooks size i and f 3-4 toy doll or bear glossary single_crochet = single_crochet in next stitch double_crochet = double_crochet in next stitch half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet in the next stitch 2dc/5dc = work 2/5 double_crochet in the next stitch same for half_double_crochet decrease = a decrease single_crochet the next two stitches together v-st = double_crochet chain-1 double_crochet into the next stitch notes 1 in this pattern turning chains 1 or 2 at the beginning or end of the row do not count as the first or last stitch a chain 3 or 4 is the beginning double_crochet or double_crochet+ch1 2 fyi i have designed two oval bases one is much rounder than the other the more oval base is closer to the bleach bottle shape of my original toy 3 when the base is complete with a total of 40 sts around all other instructions are the same for either shape/style prettyknittyjewelry designs 2023 llc the pattern round base flat double-thick no need for a mattress round 1 with mc and larger hook make a magic_ring 12hdc close ring round 2 ch2 2hdc x3 half_double_crochet x3 x2 join 18 sts round 3 ch2 2hdc half_double_crochet x3 half_double_crochet x3 x2 join 24 sts round 4 ch2 2hdc half_double_crochet x4 half_double_crochet x4 x2 join 32 sts round 5 ch2 2hdc half_double_crochet
